meanings.definition: To make (someone) a member of the proletariat.
meanings.sent1: The factory owner was proletarianizing the workers by paying them low wages.
meanings.sent2: The new government policy aimed at proletarianizing more citizens by providing equal opportunities.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick involved proletarianizing the audience into believing they had special powers.
meanings.sent4: The artist's brush strokes were proletarianizing the canvas, transforming it into a scene of everyday life.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's inspiring words were proletarianizing the students, empowering them to strive for success.

meanings.definition: To cause (something) to become characteristic of the proletariat.
meanings.sent1: The economic downturn was proletarianizing the once affluent neighborhood.
meanings.sent2: The cultural shift was slowly proletarianizing the traditional values of the society.
meanings.sent3: The fashion designer was playfully proletarianizing high-end fashion by adding street style elements.
meanings.sent4: The music festival was proletarianizing the music scene, making it more accessible to all.
meanings.sent5: The storm's destruction was proletarianizing the landscape, turning it into a scene of struggle and resilience.
